Comments_List: I was able to furthe develop my presentation skills and learn about research in fields I was relatively unfamiliar with.
Chalk talks by faculty would be preferred over power point presentations.

The course did a thourough job in covering many research topics, most with strong clinical significance. However, there were instances when the duration of the class sessions seemed a quite long and seemed to drag on. I would recommend potentially shortening the class time. I would also like to have more seasoned faculty present. It would be interesting to have one session be on NIH grants and funding and how grants are evaluated with potentially a mock grant review session.

With some modifications, I would recommend it. I would perhaps shorten the duration of the course and I would try to increase the amount of dinner with faculty after the presentations. This would allow more students presenters the opportunity to engage with the guest faculty and instructors and would incentivice students with their presentations.
